title: Tuscan Meat Sauce
introduction: This rich and flavorful Tuscan Meat Sauce combines the sweet notes of spices and lemon zest with savory beef and pork. Perfectly matched with a hearty pasta like pici, this dish offers depth and warmth ideal for any comforting meal.

ingredients.item: boneless beef chuck, cut into 2-inch pieces
Italian sweet sausages or ground pork
fresh tomatoes or 1 (28-ounce) can imported Italian peeled tomatoes, chopped
homemade Meat Broth or store-bought beef broth
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions: In a large saucepan, melt the butter with the olive oil over medium heat. Add the prosciutto and chopped vegetables and cook, stirring frequently, for 15 minutes.
Stir in the meats and cook, stirring frequently, until browned, about 20 minutes.
Add the tomatoes, broth, wine, lemon zest, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt and pepper to taste. Bring the mixture to a simmer. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce is thickened, about 2 hours.
Remove the beef chunks from the pot. Place them on a cutting board and chop into small pieces. Stir the chopped meat into the sauce. Serve hot.
variations: Can be made ahead and stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator up to 3 days or in the freezer up to 2 months.
